resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
tianchen92 commented on pull request #5293: ARROW-6464: [Java] Refactor FixedSizeListVector#splitAndTransfer with slice API
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5293
 
 
   Related to [ARROW-6464](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6464).
   
   Currently FixedSizeListVector#splitAndTransfer actually use copyValueSafe which has memory copy, we should use slice API instead.
   Meanwhile, splitAndTransfer in all classes should position index check at beginning.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

jacques-n commented on pull request #5293: ARROW-6464: [Java] Refactor FixedSizeListVector#splitAndTransfer with slice API
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5293#discussion_r321398491
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/complex/FixedSizeListVector.java
 ##########
 @@ -579,10 +579,74 @@ public void transfer() {
 
     @Override
     public void splitAndTransfer(int startIndex, int length) {
+      assert startIndex + length <= valueCount;
 
 Review comment:
   Assertions should be used for checking arguments, only internal concerns. This is failed assertions produce Java Errors which are not caught by traditional catch clauses. Please use something akin to Preconditions.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

 ##########

siddharthteotia commented on issue #5293: ARROW-6464: [Java] Refactor FixedSizeListVector#splitAndTransfer with slice API
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5293#issuecomment-541291850
 
 
   LFGTM. However, I would suggest to add as many tests as possible to cover exhaustive set of corner cases with validity transfer. In the past there were so many boundary cases that were found as bugs and were incredibly hard to debug/reproduce. It would be great if you can do that in this or follow-up PR.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Currently {{FixedSizeListVector#splitAndTransfer}} actually use {{copyValueSafe}} which has memory copy, we should use slice API instead.

Meanwhile, {{splitAndTransfer}} in all classes should position index check at beginning.
